head.citation-title: The implicitly restarted multi-symplectic block-Lanczos method for large-scale Hermitian quaternion matrix eigenvalue problem and applications
head.abstracts: © 2022 Elsevier B.V.The large-scale Hermitian quaternion eigenvalue problem has become the key issue of color image recognition. However, there are still lack of efficient iterative methods of computing its partial eigenpairs. To solve this problem, a new implicitly restarted multi-symplectic block-Lanczos method is proposed with generalizing the block and implicit restarting techniques to quaternion matrix eigenvalue computation. The proposed algorithm is applied to color image identification and approximation, and the experimental results demonstrate its efficiency and advantages to the existing algorithms.

translated-sourcetitle.$: Journal of Computational and Applied Mathematics

source.sourcetitle: Journal of Computational and Applied Mathematics

grant-text.$: This paper is supported by the National Natural Science Foundation of China under grants 12171210, 11771188 and 12090011, the Natural Science Research of Jiangsu Higher Education Institutions of China under grant 21KJA110001, the Provincial Natural Science Foundation of Fujian of China under grant 2022J01378, the Priority Academic Program Development Project (PAPD), and the Top-notch Academic Programs Project (No. PPZY2015A013) of Jiangsu Higher Education Institutions, and 0014/2019/A from FDCT of Macao.
